The camera broke and I trashed it.

title: Update fixed
text: Not the first time I have had trouble with the app (on my phone as well as connecting online). This most recent issue seems similar to the first although the remedy for the first issue has not resolved this one. I noticed this past week that when logging in, the app stated that it was searching for the stream, but then wouldn't load (on my phone) but was working fine using the website. However, today both the website and phone app have my camera listed as offline while it is most definitely on and working as I can see full wifi connection and video on my monitor. I noticed other reviews mentioning similar issues. It would be great if this could be resolved so I can use my monitor as I intended when I purchased it.

title: Highly Recommended
text: The monitor’s picture quality is great and the screen size is perfect.  It also has a 5-hour rechargeable battery.  The camera can be mounted to the wall.  The microphone/sound is clear.  (There is a very short delay from when a sound is made to when it’s heard but not major).  The picture and sound quality through the App is awesome and the connection was quick and easy to set up.  The App also has cool baby trend tracking features.

title: Gets Better and Better
text: We’ve had our cameras for 2 years and at first they were limited in their coverage but now they have been upgraded and Wow. We use one to check on our 3 & 4 year old at night and the other in the kitchen to watch for midnight kitchen raiders. Lol. We can even check them while away from home from anywhere, as long as we have access to the internet. It was easy to install and can be moved just about anywhere you have coverage from your WiFi. Worth the money 100 X over.

title: Camera and sound
text: So I’ve tried SEVERAL different cameras and brands. This one is by far the best quality. It’s a bit expensive but it’s worth every cent and more. I can see my child sleeping, it lets me know when he moves or makes sounds, it’s reaches throughout my entire 1,200sq ft. Apartment and I can connect more than one camera to the app, I can not only see and hear my son but talk back to him or even have a book read to him. We have the connect view 65 plus and I absolutely love it.!

title: Baby monitor
text: So I have ALWAYS wanted security cameras to feel safer but here recently unfortunately, I have needed actually one. I honestly couldn’t afford the expensive home security ones so I saw this “baby monitor” and let me just say I LOVE IT because it does just want I wanted until I can afford something bigger. Thank you so much for this product now I can feel safe not only being home but being away from home without spending a ton of money! Who knew a baby monitor?! I love it!!!!

title: Mediocre then better now doesn't work at all
text:
The old version of the app wasn't pretty, but it worked and was fine. The newer version was fancier, though not as intuitive. The latest update (5.0.22) does not work at all. Never connects to the camera even though the separate monitor works fine. Really bummed out, since we bought this one so we could be away from the actual monitor. Follow up: the support form doesn't work on mobile, both in the app and in a browser. Completely useless.

Updated based on new version: with this update, the app crashes constantly. I did get everything hooked back up (what a pain) and now it crashes pretty much whenever I do something (pan the camera, take a picture, turn the sound on or off).

title: Video doesn’t work
text: We’ve contacted customer support multiple times now and still no resolution. First, the camera used to work with minimal buffering, but after 6 months, and now 6 months after the video stopped working, there is still no resolution. We can’t monitor our baby. It happens on both my wife’s phone and my own. The view screen that came with camera works fine, but we specifically bought this so we could monitor from our phones.  Motorola are completely ignoring this problem thus giving a middle finger to the care of our infant. The video on this app does not work. Plain and simple. I’m done with this product, their horrible customer service, and you should save yourself the money and buy something else.

title: Would recommend to EVERYONE
text: Not only is this app amazing but it is even more so considering everything you need is FREE (other than the camera of course).  Took me a little bit to get it synced and all set up. A lot of which was my own fault.  Once I worked everything out on my end, I couldn’t ask for a better system to keep an eye on my new born baby boy!! I am soo happy with this that I am going to pay for the add on features. If this is what I get for free, I could only imagine what more if I pay for it.

title: App needs work!
text:
I do appreciate being able to view the baby monitor on my phone. However, there are numerous problems with the app. The time is never right. The movement doesn’t work well. The sound cuts in and out... and, most recently, 
 the background monitoring doesn’t work. This is all so frustrating as we’ve spent good money for this setup- particularly so that we can use a good app on our phones. 

The other thing that is bothersome is that there is horrible feedback after about a half hour of using the parent unit. We tried to get a new one but we’re out of warranty and it turns out the company doesn't sell parent units separately (at least not the model I have). So disappointing!

title: Terrible!!
text: This app has never worked superbly, but before the update at least it worked! Tonight it told me that baby’s room was 32F.  We live in the south... I would have had to put him to bed in a walk in freezer! It only keeps the camera online for an hour or so before it crashes and the camera says offline, and everything has to be reset.  This app is what I rely on while sleeping to know if my little one needs me since the nursery is out of range of the monitor base despite being in the same house on the same floor.  I would not recommend or ever purchase another Motorola monitor! Now, since our workaround the terrible monitor was the app and it is crap too, I am probably going to just trash the whole setup and go with a different brand all together.

title: Avoid
text: I think this camera in the year I’ve had it, it has NOT connected more times then it’s actually done it’s job. We are talking about NOT working in two different houses, both with great internet, we’ve tried 2 different cameras (because we returned one) in different locations in the houses, and still the camera takes FOREVER to connect when we re-pair it with the app and that only lasts for maybe a couple hours if we are lucky! The idea of seeing our son when we need to is impossible, without physically walking in the room opening the door, and waking him up. I cannot express how upset we are all we wanted was a safe way watch our son sleep and play but thanks to the bad camera, connection, app, etc. that’s not possible.

title: Night Vision
text: Our night vision stopped working. I called the tech support and they told me it was because of the latest update on the app. Apparently the brightness was put to the lowest setting and that is causing the issue. Support said to adjust the brightness and it will work...that did not work. If an update on the app causes the camera not to properly work than what’s the point. I can’t see my child throughout the night and rather frustrated that this product and it’s related app are not working properly and tech service says to wait for another app update to see if that fixes the issue. Seriously? Horrible customer service and not a good answer to tell a concerned parent.

title: SO BAD
text: We got this as a gift from my parents for our first child. Now that she’s almost 4 months old we’ve begun to start using it in her nursery. Nothing on the app works... I disconnected and reconnected the camera to download the updates and nothing changed... every time I try to change something (sound sensitivity, motion detection, etc.) I get a 30 second “loading” and then “update failed” Like being a new mom isn’t hard enough now I have to battle with technology that is supposed to make my life easier. Not to mention we just spent $100 to access certain features on the app. What’s the point if it doesn’t even work??

title: IN A CLASS OF ITS OWN
text: Having tried other software and products before with disappointing results, “Hubble” brings such a relief and simplicity into the world of remote viewing. The Motorola FOCUS68 works seamlessly with the Hubble app. Setup was straightforward, simple and always connect remotely from home without fail. Picture is perfect, voice I would rate a 3.5 out of 5 stars. Overall it’s a great product that does not put a hole in ones pocket, in comparison to other more expensive products that does not even come close . SOLID AS A ROCK.!!!

title: Hub Hub Hubble!
text: Easy set up, simple operation, inexpensive monitoring. This system is easily movable you can take it with you anywhere.  The stream is clear and it’s easy to see everything. The sound quality is amazing! I can hear the slightest little cough or sneeze! The motion detector is as sensitive as you want it. If tossing and turning all night is what your baby does this system is a must! You can turn the sensitivity down and only get the notifications that you really need to see! The only downside is it’s not easily hidden. Quality that matters, when it matters!

title: I don’t get it
text: We’ve had two monitors for almost a year now. I initially only installed one camera to test drive it. After weeks of terrible performance and failed customer service to identify the issues—constant break in feed, app loading indefinitely, if at all, etc—I decided to unplug it. We stopped using it bc the app was SO bad. Super slow, not intuitive, not responsive. Then today, months after unplugging, I decided to give it another try (our kid is now climbing the crib wall, so seems like a good timing). I can’t even adjust where the camera is pointing bc the app won’t load the camera (can only view feed via url), so it’s pointing at our ceiling. I’m ready to use these as trash weights. So disappointed! They were super expensive!!!

title: Bad App - Ok cameras
text: I have a MBP855, while the monitor and the camera works great the pairing process and app is the worst I have seen. When trying to add it to your network it fails, you have to try at least 6 times for it to finally work. Do nothing different just re-pair over and over. If you take the camera with you, one can not simply update the WiFi you have to delete the camera then re-pair it, once again taking over 6 attempts.  I have tired multiple WiFi’s with different settings along with multiple iOS devices with the same results. I recommend the camera but if you are looking for a WiFi connected camera STAY AWAY, you can find much better ones with better apps and simple setup.

title: I’m not paying more!
text:
I’m extremely disappointed that you (Hubble) are asking us to pay for a streaming subscription. I personally don’t think it’s right to pay anything after I already paid over $100 for the camera. I  don’t need it to document noises or movements. If that is the subscription I’m being asked to pay for I don’t want it. I just want to be able to check on my daughter at any time. title: Love it highly recommend
text: I got this as a gift for my baby girl and I love it now that she sleeps more through the night it’s easy for me to sleep on my own and have my phone next to me while I’m in the next room and notify me when she wakes up or makes any noises as a new mommy is eases my mind about leaving her in her crib alone while I’m in bed also wings her off of being with me in my room and beginning of her independence! Love this app/ camera thanks to my husbands aunt Monica 💙

title: The best!!
text: This is the second Motorola brand video monitor I’ve had. I purchased another because I needed more cameras and sought Motorola out specifically. I absolutely love them! I had no idea I could link them to my phone on top of having the parent monitor until I was setting them up. Video Quality is great and I love that I can’t position the camera without touching it. I’d recommend these to anyone! Probably purchasing more cameras to link in the near future.

title: Slower than two turtles crawling through peanut butter in January
text: This app is HORRIBLE. Takes F O R E V E R for anything to load. Trying to turn camera on or off on the app? FORGET ABOUT IT! The cameras with the monitor are wonderful. Using the app is a whole different nightmare. More parameters on notifications would be a great start along with more speed, reliability, and stability. I don’t need 10 notifications in 2 minutes about a noise or movement. I actually turned my movement off because NOTHING WAS MOVING and I was getting alerts constantly. The noise should give ONE alert in a set timeframe. Even Safety First has that figured out. Separate logins for parents instead of having to share a login would be stellar! Time to go back to the drawing board with your app Motorola....

title: Issues
text: I've been using the 860 camera for 3months and I have 2 of them. Both cameras go to the cloud mode when I prefer the SD mode therefore I am unable to record any movement when I am away from home unless I look at my phone and change it back. Yes I know that it take snapshots of motion but the movement can be 10 seconds before whoever passes in front of the came therefore it serve no purpose in cloud mode...I don't know if it's their way of trying to get me to purchase the cloud service. Also the connection to the cameras keeps dropping and I have high speed internet. And I get error message when I try to live stream of no internet connection which is not true.

title: Back to 1 star
text: Each “update” makes it worse. Just updated hoping to come back here and boost the rating to 3 stars. Unfortunately, the “solution” for the “daylight savings time“ & “mystery random time-change” issues appears to be “remove the ability to change the timezone entirely”.. Now I’m stuck with some cameras/events being off by an hour (they apparently reset again between the time I corrected them this morning & when I updated the app after lunch) and no way to correct it now! Add to this the consistent connection issues, poor stream quality, plus event stream/download failures, and the app goes back to 1 star, because 0 is not an option.

title: Improved After Use / Raising Rating
text: I initially had some major tech hickups with this system. I worked in tech for years so I do know what I’m talking about as it relates to software and hardware. The hardware and the technology is excellent. The actual downloadable app needs work. After using it for about a full day now, and two firmware updates, it appears to be stable. It’s working, but based on how things went initially, I’m cautious but optimistic. Very high quality image in any case. The camera quality is as about as good as one can expect.

title: Would be great, if it worked
text:
I see the potential with this app and when it’s working I’m really happy I have it. But I would say it doesn’t work more than it does.

First, connecting to the stream can take a pretty long time, so long it’ll regularly time out. If you get connected, the stream doesn’t stay connected for long. There are a lot of breaks in the stream.

Second, the event stream rarely works for me. I’ll get some recent images sometimes but for the most part I see “no recent events” even though there have been plenty every day.

Lastly, and this is more recent, the app itself will completely time out. It’s like I’ve pressed the home button, to get back to my home screen when I haven’t.

To me, these flaws are pretty significant because they are the reason to have the app! You want to be able to check in and see what has recently happened as well as what’s currently going on. That is a challenge and incredibly frustrating.

I wish I could exchange for something different.

title: Great app (one typo to mention)
text: Overall great app. The temperature doesn’t seem to update as frequently as the physical monitor that comes with the device but it’s not usually far off. One typo to note is the streaming speed shows as “kpbs” when it should be “kbps” in the OSD of the camera in the app. Didn’t know how to submit this other than a comment.... obviously doesn’t affect the overall quality of the app. Very good app and definitely recommend.

title: Still not where it should be
text: Takes a bit of time to stop buffering but I still love it. I especially love being able to zoom in. There’s really only one thing I don’t like and it’s the temperature settings. Our upstairs becomes very hot compared to the downstairs and varies depending how much the outside temp drops at night as we live in an old building. There’s been a lot of nights my toddler wakes up drenched in sweat because the high temp alert can only start alerting at 78. The app would be so much better if the temp settings were updated. Being able to alert high temp starting at 68 or 70 would be great.

title: Buffers too long and event history not current
text: Not once has the stream loaded immediately. It always loads for some time. Very frustrating when trying to do a quick check on the baby. Next, the “event history” feature doesn’t work correctly for me. Often times it won’t capture ANY information for a period of time. I like to check the app in the morning to see the approximate time my child woke up, and many times it simply doesn’t capture any information from the last several hours. I know it’s not possible that my child didn’t “move” upon waking up, so I don’t know why the camera doesn’t always pick up on his motion. Wish I knew about this app before buying the camera.

title: Many unanswered questions
text: My camera did not come with a manual; only a quick start guide. The app needs to have the ability to pause the camera when I’m home. Right now I have to put something in front of the camera to stop it from constantly notifying me of motion!  It also came with the focus tag but I have no idea what its purpose is or how to set it up. I paired it but it didn’t do anything. I emailed the company last week for help and haven’t heard anything. Also it won’t let me delete sound detected. It seems to have great potential but the app and instructions are sorely lacking.

title: Great Concept but NEEDS WORK
text:
I bought one pair of these cameras, they work fine for probably 2hrs and suddenly one of them went OFFLINE!! I tried to repair it and didn’t work! Hard reset don’t work as well! When I erased the camera that didn’t work I couldn’t even see it online because the light that used to blink just stayed SOLID BLUE, that’s mean the camera can’t be discovered nor pairing.... 
   I brought it back and got a new one, it did EXACTLY THE SAME DANM THING....  I really like the cameras, theres a lot of cool features. You can talk through the app, play music etc.... and most importantly you can actually hear what people are saying through the live recording!! PLEASE FIX THE ISSUE......

title: Disappointed
text: The camera itself and the display are great. They work perfectly. When we bought this(roughly 7-8 months ago) this app was completely free. It was great! The display wouldn't stay connected out in the barn so being able to connect with my phone was a nice little feature. Fast forward to today. Now all of a sudden I need a plan to view my camera from my phone or tablet?! And for $300/yr ?!?! You guys are crazy. I was extremely happy with this when we first bought it. Now for all of the stuff I had when it was first bought I have to pay more than what the camera cost every year?!?! That is insane. I feel like Motorola just hired Martin Shkreli so they could up the cost to consumers

title: Terrible
text: I have a 4 month old who sleeps in her crib . The app is very unreliable . I used it because the monitor is such a pain ! It doesn’t work . Sad because I was willing to accept the fact that the monitor didn’t work because the app was functional at first but now I regret not returning it .

title: Functional but flawed
text: App is functional, however very basic. This app is functional for the most part, except it doesn’t allow for the digital tilt function on my Connect40PU. Also, the firmware update feature, other than being super slow, fails at the 76% mark during “processing“. Why so many Hubble apps in the App Store, all with similar functions, very confusing!

title: Fix the connection. PLEASE.
text:
Update after update and the camera is still constantly “offline.” The app now also cannot find any WiFi networks. We bought the camera based on its reviews and wish we had read the app reviews before purchasing. This is just not suitable for monitoring a child. What do parents need? Reliability. #1. This is simply a failure by Motorola. All the great features of this camera are worthless if it can’t connect. Will be replacing this with something more reliable. Motorola, you are NOT listening to customer feedback.

title: Never connects!
text:

at work, I tried probably six times to view the cameras. It never once connected. Useless! I have been extremely disappointed with this app. Would not recommend at all.

title: Slow...Slow....Slow...unresponsive...CRASH CRASH CRASH
text: This app is soo slow, and no its not my internet connection... This app is so unreliable, I cant believe has the Motorola name on it. title: Complaint
text: Needs a little bit faster connection (my WiFi is solid nothing lags) when I get notification “sound detected” by the time I can check wether it is a false alarm or not it’s already to late, not a consistent issue but it still does happen and is very inconvenient when it does, other then that everything is great just needs that solid connect, I would rate easy 9/10 for money I spent on this product.

title: Poor
text:
I’m annoyed at myself for purchasing this camera now. 
We have been using it since my baby was born, now 10 Months old. My baby sleeps in their own room so I use the camera with the volume up every night. (Baby sleeps though the night) after a COUPLE of hours, the sound starts to JUMP!! I have to close it and reopen it to fix it. Just recently it has started to lose the picture completely but keep sound. I don’t do anything different with the app or settings etc.

title: Great.. I don’t think so...
text:
I purchased this camera to help me, and it’s honestly more of a hassle.. 
I purchased it thinking it would be better then the ones I have.  No matter how many times I have tried, several times for that matter. title: Frustrating
text: Over the approximate 2 years (five or take) I’ve been using this app, it has improved on occasion and gotten bad on occasion.  Right now it’s back losing a consistent connection.  No idea why- and hopefully it’s temporary.  I’ve got 100% signal strength, no other devices competing for the WiFi when it happens.  I’ve tried uninstalling the app and reinstalling.  I’ve tried different tricks with my network.  Honestly- there’s worse cameras out there which is why I gave it 2 stars instead of 1.  Using the closed circuit monitor works flawlessly. title: Life saver
text: We are on a long trip and we packed our camera and the monitor we check our baby on but forgot the cord to the monitor so luckily we downloaded this app and it's a life saver! Being from one end while our baby is on the other end we can't hear so we just get on the app and check him. It takes a couple seconds to buffer but it's not life threatening. When we go back home we probably won't need it but it's nice to have a back-up.

title: Look elsewhere—very unreliable app.
text: I bought our monitor because I really wanted one that was compatible with an app, but there are few to choose from. This app CONSTANTLY breaks to “get the stream” without giving you any indication (like a sound) that it’s not actually currently giving you feedback (unless of course you happen to be staring at it). Also, no matter how many times you set the temp reading to Fahrenheit, it always just goes back to celsius. So unless your accustomed to reading both, it’s a positively useless feature on a very important matter (baby’s room temp). I use an iPhone 11 with this app, fyi. Looks elsewhere for a monitor app.

title: Stopped Sending Notifcations
text: I’ve had this monitor and app since September, and it’s been good with the exception of buffering issues, but then it totally stopped sending notifications! I tried EVERYTHING, but I really can’t have this monitor if it’s not going to alert me when there’s noise/motion in my 20-month olds room. I went into settings, tried to troubleshoot online (which was worthless), went into Apple settings, reset my phone and restarted my app, and nothing has worked. Baby monitors should have easily reachable support and this has left me extremely disappointed.

title: Unreliable
text: Bought a Motorola monitor against my better judgement after seeing the reviews of the camera itself. I got it home and it was easy to plug in and set up. I’m happy with the cameos itself. The app is just terrible. Really really bad. Works fine if your at home connected to WiFi, but I got this particular camera because it came with a parent unit and the app so that I could view the camera when not home. If you are not connected to WiFi just forget about this app connecting to the stream. It was hit or miss the first day I used it, not it will not connect at all when using LTE. I want to return the camera. What is the use of a camera if the app itself is worthless?

title: Unhappy
text:
This app worked great at first. 
Now the video's freeze, the notification is going crazy alerting my phone 5 times when someone passes by the camera. 
Both of my cameras are pointed toward the front door, one gets twice as many events as the other camera. It should be the same.

Looking for new security today!

title: Simultaneous Live Streaming.
text: Thank you for the Notification fix but there’s another issue that I’ve discovered. I have 3 focus 66 cameras and I’ve been enjoying the SLS feature where I can monitor all 3 cams at the same time on the same screen. However, when I added a fourth camera (Focus 86T), the ability to go to SLS has completely disappeared. The icon that used to be on the upper left side to activate the feature went away. I was under the impression that the App can handle several cameras at the same time.

title: Great since version 5
text:
Recently version 5 of this app has been released, and it is now much better to use. I used to be unable to access the camera reliably, but this has been flawless since the upgrade. Further, the UI is just much better than it used to be.

We have had a second baby and so need to upgrade to two monitors. With the old app, I was considering getting a different camera so that I could avoid Hubble. Now I don’t have to worry about that any more.

title: WiFi does not work...
text: Both my neighbor and I have Hubble monitors and neither of us were able to connect for monitoring. The two cameras we have are worthless if we can’t use them. Hell, I would prefer a simple baby monitor for sound only, this one brings nothing to the table when their network isn’t working. Fix this, it is not my internet or my app or my camera. Fix your network - looks like a lot of other people have the same issue, not sure where these 5 star reviews are coming from but I doubt it is the east coast... is it because I’m using freemium? We paid enough for the cameras, I’d like a refund of you are stopping Services for those using WiFi

title: Baby Monitor & App Review
text: I too have had countless issues with my Motorola baby monitors. To my own fault i have now purchased three because i liked the app feature which most other brands did not offer. Never again will i buy a Motorola product. I’ve emailed the company and only heard back once with an automatic reply with how to troubleshoot. My monitor does not work. It constantly goes in and out of service beeping and not showing the picture of the crib. And same for the app- even with updates and full WiFi it constantly appears to have the circle. Motorola has not tried to help me fix the issue or offer an exchange or refund. I am beyond frustrated with my experience.

title: Unreliable
text: The camera itself is pretty good and the provided handheld unit to access the camera the same. But the app is really unreliable - every time I open the app it shows my camera as turned off, even though it’s not and the handheld unit is working fine. When trying to turn it “on”, the app just spins. Only way to resolve it is to log out and log back in on the app - sorry, that’s not gonna happen at 2am when we need to check on the baby. The rest of the app seems pretty buggy also (temperature varies wildly, doesn’t track activity accurately, etc). Not worth using the app, so if that’s a big selling point in a baby monitor for you, look elsewhere.

title: Exceeds expectations
text: We were pleasantly surprised by the clarity of the camera for the price we paid. It’s so clear! And the app is so user friendly. I also love the added feature of the tracking portion. So when I’m nursing at night I can track the length of time she nursed, last diaper change, etc. I don’t often remember that for my midnight feedings so it’s helpful to have this. With every penny!

title: Had potential... HAD
text: I really wanted to love this camera. It promised great things. There is however a very good reason this app has the rating it does. GOOD LUCK KEEPING IT WORKING! My issue is mainly an app issue, it NEVER loads. We have 400Mbps with a 40Mbps upload, so they can’t say it’s an internet thing. I have a 6 channel router... I have followed every single trouble shooting there is. Nothing worked. Half the time the camera doesn’t even want to respond like another person mentioned. AND YOU CANT CONTROL THE MOVEMENT! One click and it FLIES in the direction. I just bought this camera in May of 2017. Here we are not even 8 months later, and I can’t even use the dang expensive thing. Save you’re money!

title: App always disconnects from camera
text: The camera itself works great and the monitor that comes with the halo is also good. The app consistently crashes and disconnects it is extremely frustrating. There will be weeks at a time that the app won’t connect to the camera. Then all of sudden without even trying to repair or connect the camera the app works but it only connects maybe that one time or few hours or few days you never know. It’s incredibly annoying and I don’t understand why they haven’t fixed this issue. I see reviews about the app always crashing from others.

title: Where Did Events Go?
text:
Used to have a days’ worth of events show up in the events tab within the app, but nothing has shown up for the last few weeks. When I go to access the sensor settings, it says motion is always on (won’t give me the option to turn it off), and that events will appear in the events tab.

I’ve had the camera for about four months and had previous issues that were resolved, but now I don’t know why events suddenly no longer show up in the tab. Any help? It can’t be that I have the free (no paid plan subscription), as it worked before.

title: Does not load video or sound, loses connection, resets sensor settings
text:
Awful!
Just horrible! Fails to load the live feed and only has some snapshots of past motion events. No sound no video. Constantly gets offline and takes 8-9 attempts to reconnect to wifi. Good luck monitoring your baby. This monitor/app let me down at the most important situations and it has caused so much frustration it's beyond. 
The sensor settings get constantly reset to nullify all values, so even if you get the online connection, there is nothing recorded because the sensors are turned off by itself! I reset them again, only to find them off a day after. What a unstable, pitiful, piece of junk app...

title: Great Camera. Horrible app.
text:
The camera works fine. The app does not. We are due any day for our baby, and we set the camera up to overlook her crib. The app will work for half a second, then freeze. Once it freezes, you have to close the app out to get the app to un-freeze. We have everything updated software wise. The wifi signal strength is 100%.

We will be going to get a different monitor because this app is obviously not going to allow us to check on our child. We could just walk all the way to her room in the amount of time it takes to get the app up and running. I was so excited about this monitor. Now, I am just disappointed.

title: Complete garbage.
text:
Hardly works on wifi, So glitchy, about a 3 second delay. Drops connection frequently. 
Does not work at all, NOT AT ALL, from outside the network. Complete and utter garbage.

...after initially writing this review I got an email from the developers. The advised me to upgrade to a newer version. It couldn't be automatically updated. I had to uninstall the app and re-download it. 

While I'll admit that there is a marginal video performance increase, it's only marginal and a the updated version is so rife with new bugs that it's actually much worse!

The app now informs me every time I open it that there is a new version and I should update - click go to store. However, there is no new version available on the store. 

Moreover, the app no longer remembers credentials so I have to re enter them every time. 

It is reporting temperature about 13 degrees higher then they actually are now. 

There are more bugs but these are the ones that are infuriating me. 

This thing is absolute trash.

title: More development needed
text:
I have to acknowledge the improvement BUT more is still needed. MUCH MORE!
It is not only the app connection with the camera but also the Camera stability online and connectivity. Quite often the app refuses to communicate with the camera and I have to restart the camera and sometimes remove it and add it to the app. 
Reliability is a key issue with this type of products and you are dealing with worrying and cautious parents here, so tough crowd! 
Development and stability needs to happen urgently otherwise you will be loosing future business for sure. 
Invest in this please and get it done.

title: Works
text:
Normally I have a great time using this app, but since there was an update about a week ago I can’t seem to get the video feed to my phone at all. It’s just the spin wheel of death (loading wheel). It wouldn’t be that bad of a problem except the battery life on the physical screen is only 30 mins... I hope this app issue gets patched soon.

Update: Their service was down and there is a website to check the service. Good to know for the future!

title: Unreliable service
text:
Poor reliability between app and camera (unclear if its one or both) and even worse customer support. We’re looking for a new system now because we can’t trust it just to give us a reliable live feed. Product has been this way pretty much from the start 4 months ago. 
And absolutely no sign of an actual ‘local’ service that they say first two devices will function on.

Update: Service team reached out to me after this review. When I responded with info requested, they never replied. Product is completely useless. Error messages and unit ‘offline’ for days.

title: If I Didn’t Need It, I’d Delete It
text: The app is a good idea but it constantly searches for the stream. I can be in the house in the same room as our router and it takes forever to find the stream. A lot of times, it never finds it. What good is a video app, if the video feature doesn’t work. Also, I’ve set the thermometer to Fahrenheit and it seems to always revert to Celsius. I think you all should spend less time adding unnecessary features like tracking a child’s development and spend more time focusing on the reason people need it for.

title: Always an issue!
text: No matter what, these cameras always give us issues. So aggravating. After having them for only about 2 months, the parent unit that came with them died. Then we were forced to use them on WiFi only. Working on and off for well over a year. For the past month or two, we cannot view our cameras at night. They won’t connect. We have had our service provider as well as a private IT service tech here to try to correct any WiFi issues within our home. I’ve spent so much money, just in an attempt to be able to watch my twins in their beds at night. Frustrated is an extreme understatement ! I’m disgusted.

title: Undependable
text: I’ve had Hubble for 2 yrs and it’s terrible! It worked for a short bit but it’s mostly spotty. The camera will be on and the app will say it’s off. Or the camera will just stop working. The app regularly has bug issues. I became so frustrated with its undependability that I bought the old fashioned baby monitors. —The trigger? One morning I woke from mothers instinct (couldn’t hear anything bc we have an air filter on turbo -thus the need for a monitor) turn out my 1yr old got her leg stuck in the crib and was screaming for who knows how long! I felt physically sick about having not been there for her sooner. Bc Hubble stopped working at random that morning. I will never rely on Hubble.

title: Can I rate zero star
text: The app is absolutely horrible. Extremely slow the camera has to be deleted and re added several times a day and if the monitor dies or turns off then the camera disconnects from the app and won’t reconnect so you have to re pair it to the app. The monitor dies after maybe an hour sometimes less on a full charge we have had this monitor going on 5 months. And they want you to pay? What a joke. Now I remember why I refuse to buy anything Motorola brand. Unfortunately it was the only one available at the time. Motorola as a whole is a joke. Save you time money and stress buy another brand. The constant updates fix nothing.

title: Get it
text:
My husband and I are so happy with this! We found this monitoring system to be “middle of the road for price “. I was worried we may have really lost out on quality , but not at all! 
 It can be used as an intercom both ways. The range is great, I can be in the yard while our daughter is asleep and still watch and hear everything. 
 It plays music and white noise if you want. 

The only reasons I gave it 4 out of 5 is because the only way the camera is meant to be set up is on a flat surface. 
   We used command strips to attach ours to the wall , which was difficult because the bottoms is not flat! I wish this came with other options for placement. A clip for the side of a crib or bassinet or a flat bottom with wall attachment options maybe.

title: Frustrating, horrible app!
text: I’ve been using this app for the past almost 2 years. I can’t stand it! The app (currently) does not work on my phone it says the camera is offline. But my iPad and husbands phone app work just fine. I work in technical support so I’m not clueless about how to use the device. The cameras tilt/pan feature works about half the time it seems, along with the microphone option. We are expecting our second child and we will be getting a whole different monitoring system than a Motorola.   This has been a horrible experience and left me one toooo many times panicked because I can’t see my child. Very disappointing.

title: Hubble app
text: I agree with what all of the other reviews are saying. I bought this baby monitor simply because it had an app I could download on my phone and use along with our monitor. My app continuously says I am offline allowing me to only see the events in pictures . I am never ever able to view a live feed on the camera and if I am it doesn’t last long. This is how it has been since I got this in which my son is now a year and a half old. I was hoping with every new update and the changes that were being made to the app things would change and they never do. If it just worked continuously it would be a great app.

title: Constantly offline for no reason and can’t get it to turn on again
text: So it is a good camera with good sound quality, night vision, temperature detection, rotation for many angles.  I wish the app was reliable so that I could use this awesome camera when I need it.  It works most of the time, but too frequently has the camera shown on the app to be offline when I need to keep an eye on my sleeping baby.  In fact it has been offline now for two days and I cannot find any controls on the app to refresh it or get it to turn on again.  Even resetting it manually does not help.  At this point, I want to replace it for something that works.

title: Offline problem ongoing since 2017
text:
Perhaps longer. Like many, however, I bought my camera based on camera reviews without checking app reviews.  Despite dozens (?) of reviews going back over the past year about offline problem, “Oliver and the Hubble Team” keep responding that this is NOT the way it is supposed to work and to let them help you. Why not fix the app so you don’t continue to have to respond to ongoing frustrations over the SAME problems OVER AND OVER!!!!?!! Talk about a broken record!

I will troubleshoot myself a couple days before giving up on Motorola after being happy with their cameras for several years.

title: UPDATED: New update terrible!!
text:
New review: App has gotten better. Still plenty of bugs, but it’s getting there. Worth 3 stars vs 1 before. 

Old Review:
Have had these cameras and the app for 2 years. Most of the app updates have been good. This one is terrible! App drops connectivity WAY more than last version and always takes longer to get connected to begin with. Updated 4 iPads and an iPhone at the same time. HUGE mistake! Wish I could go back.....but I've never had a large of a drop in service from any other upgrade...

title: Would recommend, worth the price!
text: Pretty great quality 👍🏻 love that I can talk through the camera. Wish the music option could sync with what’s on my phone, or I could put a radio station on or something. The music it has is alright, but sounds kind of “tin can”-y. A little hollow. But honestly that’s not really important. Sound detection is super sensitive. Would give 5 stars, but I haven’t tried it away from home yet to be sure it’s still this good. Nice product!

title: Current version NOT WORKING

Please fix this bug ASAP! This just rendered the whole system unusable!!!

title: Pretty good, but one a simple feature could make it great
text: I’ve watched this app steadily improve over the last few years. I really appreciate the improvements that have already been made, but in order for this app to be truly useful, the motion detection scheduling could use some improvements. Most apps allow you to automatically enable motion detection when you are away from the home. I think they use the phone’s location to achieve this feature. Can you add this feature?

title: Stops working daily
text: At first this was a fantastic camera. The last two months it’s been non stop going offline and I’ve had to remove the camera and go through the entire setup process almost daily. It’s not my WiFi that’s causing this issue either. I try to repair it and that doesn’t work. The only thing that works is to remove the camera and go through the setup over and over. Then it only works for a day. Super disappointed because my son is 7 months and I use this overnight. There have been times I’ve woken to him crying loudly vs being woke up on the monitor/app first since it goes offline constantly.

title: Good choice
text: App is good. Some people are not following all instructions. If you use the wifi then the app is solid and there will seldom be any screen freezes. If you have issues make sure your wifi is solid as that may be the culprit. Also make sure you update the app to its most current version. Initial setup is a little figuring out. It's not too bad. Call customer service if you need help.

title: Terrible
text:
I nanny a baby and I log on under his moms account. At first there were no issues his mom and I were both logged in and we could both look in on him which was nice for when I was watching him and she could check in at her job. Then it kicked me off the app and we have both tried getting back into the app and it won’t let me back on which is problematic since I’m watching him and I can’t always check on him or he will wake up etc.... 
If They could help me and fix these issues that would be wonderful.

I wouldn’t recommend this until they can finally fix all the issues that this app has. Just TERRIBLE!

title: Love the app
text: Love everything about this camera and app. My only complaint is that sometimes the cameras go offline, for no reason. So you have to remove it off the app and add it back, which takes time. And if you put your baby to sleep and then realize it’s offline.. you have to wait til they wake up to fix it OR wake them up in the process.. not cool. But other than that, love this camera!

title: Horrible!
text:
I wish I read the reviews on the app before purchasing these cameras; unfortunately, I o my read the reviews on the cameras themselves. 
As other reviews state, The app is completely unreliable. It works MAYBE 10% of the time, then either buffers or says the camera is not connected for the other 90%. And that is with me in the house, connected to the same WiFi. Forget trying to actually remotely access and view your child. 
I’ve done the re-set, and the re-configuration, and everything else that was suggested on other reviews- no change. DO NOT bother with these cameras if you are wanting the WiFi functionality.

title: Easy to use and does exactly what is needed
text: We found the app and Lux65 system easy to use. Tons of free features that come with the equipment which is what made us choose this system over nannit and owlet. Both Hubble apps are easy to use and setup the devices. Highly recommend for multi camera needs and parents with more than one child.

title: App still horrible and monitor is the worst
text: Never have a ever experienced so many issues with an app and product that cost more than 300 dollars. The monitor is atrocious and we’ve only had it for two years, can’t see a thing at night. Therefore we try to use the app. It it doesn’t load or takes forever to do so and often just says no signal even when there is. The WORST app ever!!! I wish we could just rerun this product and never have to use this app again. It’s all so bad. Why doesn’t moterolla care about this product? It monitors my baby for Godssake. If I had the chance to choose another product I would.

title: Great quality camera
text: Lots of control and features that similarly priced baby monitors don’t have. Manual control of the night vision feature is great and the video stream is very clear. The cameras wide angle lens is nice and the lullaby and story mode is awesome. The only complaint is the dedicated video monitor has a little interference in the audio and can sound scratchy when running a sound machine. Other than that the best value in its price range.

title: Good but temp is in Celsius only?!
text:
I have the app on all my devices but for some reason on the iPhone it’s in Celsius and won’t let me change it regarding the temperature. Other than that it’s pretty good. I wish the response time was faster. It has a slight delay of about 2 seconds I find. 

The other issue is the monitor that came with the camera with volume all the way up is hard to hear and has feedback.  Not sure I’ll be purchasing this ever again but then again this is my last baby so I doubt I’ll need to.

title: Long delay in video feedback
text: They app works most of the time (occasionally crashes to home screen on phone when loading the stream from the camera). The people complaining about timing out need to adjust their settings. However the delay from real time and what I see on my phone seems to be getting longer and longer. This isn’t a WiFi or internet speed issue as other apps pickup video and playback with nearly no delay on WiFi only. I can live with a second or two but what happens when the current 4-5+ delay endangers my child?

title: My camera doesn’t work anymore!
text: I have been using the Focus 68 camera for some time now and everything was fine. I did not have to pay a monthly fee for anything and now Hubble upgraded their app and all of a sudden my camera stopped working. I have emailed them several times and have received no response. I have also tried to pair my camera dozens of times and still nothing. I’m very disappointed because the whole point of me feeling safe about my home being watched is not an option any longer. Can someone please get back to me about this?

title: Great camera!
text: Love being able to move the camera in any direction from my phone to see where my dog is now at in the house. I also like being able to talk to her and tell her to stop when she starts doing something she isn’t supposed to be doing lol absolutely love this camera. I gave it a 4 though because there is a very slight delay when anyone moves but other than that it’s perfect!

title: Getting Better 👍
text: My initial review from a few months ago was poor. I received an email from them asking for details on the issues that I was having with getting the app to connect. The next update made a HUGE improvement! Thank you for listening! The only thing preventing a 5 star review is that the event history has been a little glitchy. I am hoping that has been fixed with this most recent update.

title: Worked alright...until it didn’t...
text: There are a lot of minor issues with this monitor, but, overall, I’ve been satisfied. The past week or so I haven’t been able to get the app to work. It keeps trying to stream until it eventually gives up and tells me to check the internet. I was a bit relieved to see the recent ratings on the app indicate that this problem is happening to others. I don’t really want to contact the support team because I really don’t see how the problem will be fixed until the app is fixed. Obviously, this is an issue and the app developers need to fix it.

title: It was a 4.5 star. Update got it demoted.

title: Save your money
text:

title: Amazing product with a bad app.

It keeps telling me to check my internet connection and make sure the camera is on but I’m connected w WiFi and I can hear my son in the background it just doesn’t let me see stream. I’ve turned it off and on, so frustrating.

title: Great product
text: I’ve had this camera for about a week now and so far it’s done everything expected. Considering getting another camera for our other child’s room!

title: Great product!
text: So convenient to have app. My daughter and I both have the app on our phones. My daughter was at the gym (I was with the baby) 4 miles away and she still received notifications. Highly recommend!

title: Keeps getting worse
text: The camera was slow to begin with.. and not able to adjust enough so i still had to walk up and adjust to an in between spot... significant delay between audio and video.. it is past return date or wed have taken it back. The latest update makes it ll but useless.. thank God i have a back up monitor from my son to use... dont waste your money...  i have iphone 8, my husband 6s.. and both same issues...

title: App rarely connects
text: The app is rarely able to connect to the camera. The camera itself is fine and the individual monitor that came with it is always connected so no problems there. But the app is just broken. I have 3 ring devices, 2 wifi lightbulbs and a tv that can all be controlled through wifi apps and don’t have any problems with them. Disappointed.

title: iPad Fail
text: One of the main reasons I bought the monitors that I did is so that I can use my iPad as a large monitor. This was a great idea in theory, but the Hubble app for the iPad is TERRIBLE. It does not work in landscape mode, and even in portrait it doesn’t work half the time as part of the screen gets blocked out by a white box. Can’t even get into the settings because nothing works to press on the left side of the app!

title: Customer support blows!
text: I’ve had a monitor that detects motion then there are no pictures to go back n see also it’s constantly said 118 degrees since the day i bought it I’ve contacted customer service several times with a ticket number give n no further response video n sound quality are great for live feed though

title: Unreliable Streaming
text: When the app works, the product is usable at best.  More often than not the streaming doesn’t even work.  Several days in a row now it says there’s an error on their end and they are working on it.  There’s not a way to contact tech support through the app, so I guess you just have to leave bad reviews 🤷‍♂️

title: Adds for a time sensitive, already paid product
text: Nothing is more frustrating then you trying to pull up your sons monitor to only have to click past a advertisement for a product you already paid for.  Oh and want the cool features on the box? Well there’s a monthly subscription. It’s a great product, just a shame it all behind a pay wall... behind the first one

title: Awesome !!
text: Really enjoy the cameras on the monitor and app it works good with WiFi and the footage is clear and voice is clear . Love that I can also speak threw the camera to my kids as well highly recommended!!

title: RETURN YOUR PURCHASE AND RUN AWAY FROM THIS APP
text: This app is complete garbage!!! Nothing on it works and when it does work it takes 10 minutes for settings to update to the camera. I wish I would’ve known. There are reviews from two years ago stating this app has problems and still nothing gets fixed/done. So disappointed. I will make sure no one buys products that use this app. Waste of money. What a shame.

title: When it works it’s great
text: I’ve been frustrated the last 3 days with the app because the app closes when trying to checkin on my little.  The whole point of me purchasing this monitor was the ability to see from my phone while at work. Not so great when you can’t. But when it does work, it’s great!!!

title: Great camera
text: Is quite a good camera and works well with the mobile. But the device and the viewing screen are not as good. Don’t know if the screen it comes with works on Bluetooth or WiFi. Connectivity issues. But on the phone it works well.

title: Excellent product
text: Images on camera are so clear and crisp. Easy setup - takes 10 minutes to set up and configure two cameras. Great monitoring cloud plan for a peace of mind, and family safety. I recommend Hubble security and monitoring products.

title: Major issues
text:
Don’t blame the WIFI its a shoddy product that is inconsistent at best.  We literally have to reboot camera 5-6 times a day.  Our WIFi is not to blame!

3-6-19

Firmware will not update; I have reinstalled camera, reinstalled app, reconfigured, tried everything possible but it will not allow me to update.

Unable to connect with Nest after that option was made available.  Extremely frustrating... have done everything I know with this issue as well with zero success.

Can’t change temperature from celsius; I don’t even have the option to do so.

I have contacted the developers via email several times with no response?

Being I live where Motorola is headquartered, I hate to see such a mismanaged product/app

title: First time
text: This is my first time using a smart baby video monitor. I have a special needs son who has Epilepsy, and needs monitoring during the night. I LOVE the fact it goes to my phone. Could feel more safe. Thank you so much

title: Peace of mind!
text: I love the fact that the camera moves and has audio features! It’s absolutely everything I was looking for! Thanks Motorola you did it again!

title: Disappointed user
text: The temp on the app is always off by up 10 degrees. I don’t know if my baby is freezing or burning up due to my constant temp adjustments. Yesterday she woke up on the monitor so I go upstairs to get her from the crib. I come back downstairs to the couch minutes later to see her on the app jumping up and down in her crib-but she’s in my arms! Obviously there was a weird 5 minute delay...and the first time I have experienced this... but makes this app even more unreliable.

title: Slow and unreliable
text: The most recent update stated that the app would run faster and be reliable. It's not. It's slower to open than before (which was slow to begin with) and I've had to sign in the last 5 out of 7 times that I tried to open the app making the whole process even slower. It seems that the most recent update needs an update.

title: Night vision stopped working
text: Had the camera for months now and it just started malfunctioning out of no where. The camera turns backwards and the night vision stopped working so you can only see the room when the lights are on. I’ve unplugged the device and deleted the app and reinstalled and nothing changes.

title: Basically worthless
text: This app is terrible (or possible it’s the hardware but either way not useable). I have to re-pair the camera almost daily to use it and when i go an check on our daughter the video on the app is offline. I have gone as far as buying a new Mesh WiFi system to fix this but no luck. Honestly i am amazed the current rating is so high bc it does not function at all.

title: Not a lot of use yet, but hope to
text: Night vision works best for me. Don’t have much light on at any one time. Works great! Wish the monitor/camera moved a bit faster maybe. Love having the microphone to be able to speak to my cats.

title: Good quality
text:
Glitchy at first, but I restarted it, and it worked fine. 
Very sensitive- I got 70 alerts during the day while no one was home. Verified that no one was home, so must have been shadows from wind blowing the trees outside and noises from the street.

title: Great for moms (& dads) like me!
text: As a FTP, I am constantly worried about my little one. Being able to check in on my baby when I am not around the monitor is amazing.  The streaming quality is great and I can honestly say I don’t have any complaints!

title: Not great
text: App has been having issues connecting for a while now. Doesnt matter if I am at home, on WiFi, LTE, or away from home, it just wont connect despite saying its online. I can hear sometimes but the video wont come through. My settings also reset a lot for no reason. It is a shame because it used to be reliable and work well. I used to be able to check my child easily, now it is just frustrating.

title: I absolutely hate this app
text: That’s right. I HATE IT! I adored the idea of only needing one monitor so that way I didn’t have to move one from floor to floor while my babies were asleep. The app was literally the selling feature for me. But it never loads! I can open the app and it would still be loading in the time it takes me to go down a full flight of stairs, into my babies room, change them and put them back down again. It’s horrible!!!

title: Aggravating and worthless
text: I’ve been using the Hubble home monitoring system for one year.  The cameras repeatedly go offline.  This is particularly discouraging when away from home and need it most.  The re-pairing function to reconnect the cameras to WiFi takes many tries before it is successful, takes about half an hour each time and has tp be done while at the camera.  I would not recommend this system to anyone.

title: Unreliable
text: Have had this app for 2+ years, and it will have short problem-free periods between long episodes of failure.  We’ve opened the app to find green screens, “unable to connect” or endless “trying to connect” so many times.  Our internet is great, no connectivity problems for anything else.  The fix we usually end up with is going into our two year old’s room to unplug and replug the camera while he’s sleeping...  Not ideal.

title: Views
text: This app would be better if you could see a stream of at least 2 kids at the same time. Also it would be better if the camera didn't move so far when adjusting it through the app. I'm hesitant to recommend this app and cameras until these issues gets updated.

title: Hit or Miss
text: I love the app when it works but it’s seems like 80% of the time I get connection error!? It’s annoying cause I’m not the biggest fan of the monitor. I do the reconnecting. Refreshing the page. Which works 50% of the time. Currently the app hasn’t had a feed all day. Connection Error, yet monitor works great! Any ideas to help me get thru the app kinks?

title: Slow and connectivity issues
text: App is slow to respond to opening and turning camera on/off and more often than not says “connectivity error” meaning I can’t view live stream despite having no internet issues.

title: Hubble connect monitors
text: These monitors record everything from video to sound. It even has night vision that shows clear and have a brightness setting. But the sound depend on your phone

title: Doesn’t pair
text: I am so frustrated trying, multiple times, to pair this with my iPhone. I have given it up completely. I had it pairs and working once. Then suddenly not!  I am using the monitor that came with the setup. So far so good with that. But considering how much it cost and it advertising the WiFi connection I can’t give it more than 2 stars. I would not recommend this to anyone!

title: Poor App Execution
text: Really bad and clunky app.  Time does not set automatically and does not adjust by daylight savings time. Have to guess the hour offset from GMT?!?!  That’s ridiculous!  Bought a second camera that never would connect, so returned it.  Works With Nest is a lie. Added it and the cameras never show up. I would recommend people investigate other camera options until Motorola gets a better app.  The Connected cam is not worth the money yet.

title: Temperature notification
text: Love being able to look at the baby from wherever, just wish the temperature settings were different.  The “notify me if temp is 78 or higher” setting specifically. 78 is too hot for our little one. Wish we had the option to set it at 74 or 75 but the app doesn’t allow for that.

title: Love it!!
text: I LOVE that I’m able to keep an eye on my elderly Mother who is in a nursing facility however, there are times when streaming isn’t able to connect it can be a little frustrating. Over all this is a great camera.

title: Update knocked my monitors off App
text:
Latest update caused me not to be able to see my monitors on the app.

Got a response from Motorola on how to fix it. Works now. Thank you. Changing my rating to 5*

title: Excellent
text: Excellent monitor had a different one before this one, this is one is by far more clear and better suited for night and a secure online viewing experience

title: Child safety and monitoring
text: Best invention ever made for spying and making sure your child or baby is safe and sound! And recording ! History check up, it gets no better!!!!

title: Update to the new operating system please
text:
I’m not sure if the new operating system has anything to do with it, but the app hasn’t been working well at all for the past week.
I check back every day hoping to see an update for your app.
I love your product and I love the app, but this week, not so much. 
It’s not the internet on my end, as everything else seems to be working fine except the app.
Please let me know if there is something else I should do.
Thank you

title: New update= useless phone use
text: Hey all, not sure what happened with the most recent update, but my wife and I can’t use our phones to check in on our baby anymore. Extended buffering times as well as constant frozen images. Also, there is no way to report issues from the app, which seems like a good way to ensure you’re not getting direct feedback. Would be glad to revise my review if you could fix this.

title: Terrible
text: Every single time Hubble does an app update (which is often) the monitor will go offline that night. Just like clockwork. You then have to repair the camera which involves pushing the pair button on the actual camera in your sleeping babies room which is mounted on the wall. Impossible and so frustrating. This monitor/camera is way too expensive to be having so many issues. I could go on but you get the idea.

title: Doesn’t work
text: The app has worked 2 times then stopped working. Sometimes I get audio but no video then an error message saying check internet and when the app troubleshoots itself it says both my phone and camera are connected to the internet 🤷‍♂️ on top of that the temperature is in Celsius and can’t be switched to Fahrenheit. I’ve looked everywhere in the settings to switch it but couldn’t find it.

title: See my baby anywhere!
text: I love this app because it is very clear and you can zoom in and out. But the best part is I can see my baby wherever I am and I get notifications if there is a sound nearby.

title: Basically unusable
text: The camera and monitor are fine, but the app is just terrible. On my home WiFi network with both my phone and the camera well in range of a good wireless router, the app buffers for a while, shows s few seconds of video, buffer more, etc...until the stream is lost. Save yourself some frustration and forget this camera even has this feature. You’ll have to rely exclusively on the monitor, so plan accordingly.

title: Excellent App
text: I use this multiple times a day. Both of my children are in this system so I can watch both babies with great quality.

title: A little delayed
text: I like the quality of the video. Crystal clear. A little delayed by a few seconds. Depending on what you use this for , the delay might not make a deal.... Unfortunately for me it does. (That’s the only con) excellent video tho.

title: Quality up up up
text: For a small, inexpensive camera, this motorola camera is huge on quality. Images are clear and precise. At night, the vision is just as good. Love it!

title: Hubble for Motorola
text: This unit gives me peace of mind because I can monitor my 91 year old mother in her condo from my home.  I’m going to put a picture of my face on the camera so when I talk she’ll remember it’s me!

title: Ok
text: This camera is ok, keeps buffering; but otherwise ok. We bought it and put it in my Mom’s room because she has Alzheimer’s and Dementia. The only thing I really don’t like and think it’s ridiculous is this you have to pay to see what happens in the middle of the night.

title: Night Vision doesn’t work
text: My night vision doesn’t auto update itself. I used to switch to ON/OFF manually through the app however that feature has stopped working since yesterday. I removed the camera from app & re-add it again but still doesn’t work. It doesn’t recognize my command.

title: Great update, but need help with new WiFi please.
text: I’m loving this update, its never functioned better ! Quick to connect and to move the camera remotely. However we just changed our WiFi and I cannot find how to connect the camera to the new WiFi please help!

title: No more free live monitoring after update!
text: App was working fine with no plan. All I needed was to view my live feed a few times a day and after the newest update it tells me I need to buy a plan. I’ll have to go with another company now. Updates normally make products/services better but this update makes everything worse. Better for their pockets though. 🙄

title: Time Zone
text: I am having to change the time zone everyday so that it is accurate. It always reverts to an hour behind my actual time. The method for changing the time zone is not user friendly and is difficult to select options.

title: Great App & Amazing Camera!!
text: Very impressed with the app tracking features and camera functionality. So far everything has been working seamlessly!

title: Love the Cameras and the Hubble App
text: Connectivity of the cameras is very consistent. Video quality even in low light is very good. App is easy to use. Very pleased with the cameras and the App!  I recommend it to friends and family

title: Smartzone
text: I recently purchased this Motorola Camera and so far I am extremely satisfied. I have the standard subscription, but I cannot figure out how to access this “Smartzone” I keep hearing about. Does anyone know how to use this????

title: Great app
text: I love this app, we purchased this monitor for our new Grandson who lives in Michigan.  We live in Florida and feel like we’re missing out on a lot of things he does, but with the app we can check on him and see how he’s growing.  💙💙💙

title: Sneak a peek
text: I am fortunate and get to see my grandchildren often but I still love to see that angelic look when they are sleeping.  This app allows me to peek whenever I want to while she sleeps soundly even though I’m about 50 miles away!

title: Used to be great. 😒
text: I’ve had this app for 2 years now, never had a consistent issues until recently. There’s basically no reason for me to have this app, it never opens the camera stream just sits there saying connecting. I have tried on WiFi, off WiFi, uninstalled and reinstalled the app-no change.  Sometimes it decides to provide the movement history sometimes it doesn’t. Used to be great, now it’s just annoying.

title: No complaints
text: We’ve had our camera for about 2 yrs now and no problems yet, thankfully. Streaming has been good and I like the programmed recording feature you can purchase for a nominal price. Great buy!

title: Fantastic monitor. Not good in low light.
text: Very, very good monitor! The only downfall is it does not work well in low light. I like using it at night to make sure my little one is still in bed and not up playing quietly. Even with his nightlight, a globe light and his humidifier light, it’s still not enough to see.

title: For a mobile baby monitor, it sure isn’t mobile friendly
text:
I need to go on the website to make changes to settings. But the website doesn’t run correctly from mobile devices. I need to be on a computer in order to use my baby monitor from my phone. 

Seems pretty stupid to me.

title: Solid camera!
text: Nice camera. Easy to use, no issues with software updates on iPhone. We use it at our in laws so we can check in without having to ask.

title: Great to watch baby on iPhone
text: I love this app because I can watch my daughter anywhere.  It works with or without WiFi. Sometimes the camera will go offline and I have to reprogram it which is frustrating but something you can live with.

title: Very happy
text: Easy to upload download share private share make albums and delete. Easy viewing and access across devices. Auto upload is very useful.

title: Auto upgrade
text: The app works well, however we need to do pairing again after the camera is upgraded, not sure whether this is a problem or normal.

title: Very good and reliable
text: Love the app and how easy it is to use - all family members have access t the baby camera when baby sitting through the App and so easy to hook up to other cameras

title: Invest in something else
text:
Hardly ever works. Issues with over heating that will not fix unless you invest in a separate fan. Simply not worth it.

Several updates over the last few months and still same issue. House is at 70 degrees and alarm sounds at least once an hour every night saying it's over 90 degrees and disconnects the monitor until it cools down. Not located near any vent and only half way up the wall. Worst monitor ever.

title: Horrible!
text:
Completely unreliable and there's no Customer Support from Motorola. The time zone change is still not updated, so I have to knock back an hour when scrubbing through the replay videos. Total crap. The developers should all be fired.

I'm returning and replacing with something that actually works to protect my baby. Motorola should be embarrassed. Better yet, I hope they get slapped with a law suit. 

Motorola, I hope you're reading these honest reviews.

title: App needs to catch up to be monitor
text: The monitor system is great, but the app? Not so great. I can’t even use it half of the time because it never stops buffering, and that’s if it loads at all. I would blame my WiFi, except everything else operates on it just fine. If the app would catch up to being as dependable as the monitor itself then that would be outstanding!

title: What happened to the notifications?
text: Love the app, works almost flawlessly with some minor problems. The audio cuts out intermittently when background monitoring is on. Also notifications don’t work anymore and I’ve verified that they’re on in settings for notifications and dedicated app settings.
